org.magnos.resource
Class ResourcePool<R extends Resource>

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.resource.ResourcePool<R>
Type Parameters:
R - The resource to pool.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceFactory<R>
public class ResourcePool<R extends Resource>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceFactory<R>

A pool of resources controlled through bounds, timing, and allocation and deallocation sizes.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Constructor Detail

ResourcePool

public ResourcePool(ResourceFactory<R> factory)
Instantiates a new ResourcePool.

Parameters:
factory - The factory used to create new resources.
Method Detail

allocate

public R allocate()
Returns a resource to use. If a resource needs to be allocated one will be, else a resource will be taken from the pool which can be reused or null will be returned if no more resources can be contained in the pool.

Specified by:
allocate in interface ResourceFactory<R extends Resource>
Returns:
A usable resource.

allocate

public int allocate(int desired)
Allocates the requested number of resources. If the number of resources requested exceeds the number of maximum possible resources the pool will be filled to its maximum size.

Parameters:
desired - The number of resources to add to the pool.
Returns:
The number of resources added to the pool.

deallocate

public int deallocate(int desired)
Deallocates the requested number of resources. If the number of resources requested exceeds the number of minimum possible resources the pool will be emptied to its minimum size.

Parameters:
desired - The number of resources to remove from the pool.
Returns:
The number of resources removed from the pool.

populate

public void populate()
Starts this pool by filling it with its initial set of resources.

empty

public void empty()
Removes all resources from the pool freeing them.

lock

public java.lang.Object lock()
Returns the lock used to control access to the pool of services.

Returns:
The reference to the lock object.

isUnderflow

public boolean isUnderflow()
Returns whether the number of resources in the pool is less than the desired minimum capacity.

Returns:
True if this pool could use more resources, otherwise false.

isOverflow

public boolean isOverflow()
Returns whether the number of resources in the pool is greater than the desired maximum capacity or the required amount of time has passed since the last allocated resource to free resources.

Returns:
True if this pool could do without resource, otherwise false.

setCapacity

public void setCapacity(int capacity)
Sets the minimum and maximum capacity of the pool. This creates a pool with a fixed number of resources which never allocates or deallocates.

Parameters:
capacity - The minimum and maximum capacity of the pool.

getMaxCapacity

public int getMaxCapacity()
Returns the maximum number of resources that can exist in the pool. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The maximum number of resources that can exist.

setMaxCapacity

public void setMaxCapacity(int maxCapacity)
Sets the maximum number of resources that can exist in the pool. This is not thread safe, therefore its affects are not guaranteed to happen immediately.

Parameters:
maxCapacity - The maximum number of resources.

getMinCapacity

public int getMinCapacity()
Returns the minimum number of resources that can exist in the pool. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The minimum number of resources that can exist.

setMinCapacity

public void setMinCapacity(int minCapacity)
Sets the minimum number of resources that can exist in the pool. This is not thread safe, therefore its affects are not guaranteed to happen immediately.

Parameters:
minCapacity - The minimum number of resources.

getAllocateSize

public int getAllocateSize()
Returns the number of resources to allocate at once when they're required. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The number of resources to allocate at once.

setAllocateSize

public void setAllocateSize(int allocateSize)
Sets the number of resources to allocate at once when they're required. This is not thread safe, therefore its affects are not guaranteed to happen immediately.

Parameters:
allocateSize - The number of resources to allocate at once.

getDeallocateSize

public int getDeallocateSize()
Returns the number of resources to deallocate at once. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The number of resources to deallocate at once.

setDeallocateSize

public void setDeallocateSize(int deallocateSize)
Sets the number of resources to allocate at once when they're required. This is not thread safe, therefore its affects are not guaranteed to happen immediately.

Parameters:
deallocateSize - The number of resources to allocate at once.

getAllocateThreshold

public long getAllocateThreshold()
Returns the minimum amount of time to wait since the last allocation before resources can be deallocated. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The minimum amount of time in milliseconds.

setAllocateThreshold

public void setAllocateThreshold(long allocateThreshold)
Sets the minimum amount of time to wait since the last allocation before resources can be deallocated. This is not thread safe, therefore its affects are not guaranteed to happen immediately.

Parameters:
allocateThreshold - The minimum amount of time in milliseconds.

getFactory

public ResourceFactory<R> getFactory()
Returns the factory used to create new resources. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The reference to the ResourceFactory.

getLastAllocateTime

public long getLastAllocateTime()
Returns the last time resources were allocated for the pool.

Returns:
The last allocation time in milliseconds.

getResourceCount

public int getResourceCount()
Returns the number of resources currently in this pool. This is not thread safe, therefore values returned may be out of date.

Returns:
The number of resources currently in this pool.

getListeners

public org.magnos.util.Notifier<ResourceListener<R>> getListeners()
Returns the notifier which manages the listeners to events in the pool. ResourceListeners can be directly added and removed to the notifier. Avoid invoking the methods of the proxy object in the notifier since it may notify the listeners falsely when an event has not actually occurred with the pool.

Returns:
The reference to the ResourceListener notifier.
